video.title: Forged in Fire
video.synopsis: Bladesmiths vie for a cash prize by forging the best metal weapons from the pages of history in this competition series featuring expert judges.

episodes.synopsis: The smiths must forge blades from Greek armor and artifacts; then two advance to the next challenge: recreating the mythical Sword of Perseus.
episodes.title: Sword of Perseus

episodes.synopsis: In a series first, the smiths forge a blade shape while unaware of the weapon they're making. Two go on to replicate the saber of Gen. George Patton.
episodes.title: General Patton's Saber

episodes.synopsis: The smiths' first challenge: make a hybrid out of the blade from one weapon and the handle from another. The second: forge an elegant Chinese jian.
episodes.title: The Jian Sword

episodes.synopsis: Power hammer Big Blu retires, so the smiths make use of its high-carbon piston heart. Next challenge: one of history's most unique hunting weapons.
episodes.title: The Rock-Throwing Crossbow

episodes.synopsis: In a Halloween special, smiths create zombie-killing weapons from the corpses of broken, decayed blades. Then, two make ghoulish medieval war scythes.
episodes.title: Halloween Edition

episodes.synopsis: After making canister Damascus blades using different-sized drill bits, two smiths recreate Central Africa's Boa-Zande sword at their home forges.
episodes.title: The Boa-Zande Sword

episodes.synopsis: The smiths labor to transform fragments of old steel into fossil Damascus signature blades. Later, two smiths recreate an elegant Musketeer's rapier.
episodes.title: The Musketeer Rapier

episodes.synopsis: Four smiths forge san mai blades from musical instruments, then two head back home to recreate the Tizona of Spain's legendary warrior, El Cid.
episodes.title: The Tizona of El Cid

episodes.synopsis: In honor of Veterans Day, the smiths forge blades from a Panzer tank. Two remaining smiths then have four days to recreate the Scottish backsword.
episodes.title: Military Tribute

episodes.synopsis: Four smiths make signature blades from different-sized springs. Then, two smiths head home to recreate a Revolutionary War-era Sergeant's Spontoon.
episodes.title: Revolutionary War Spontoon

episodes.synopsis: The smiths forge the Pugio, a dagger used by Julius Caesar's assassins, as well as the vicious Spatha, a legendary sword from Roman history.
episodes.title: The Barbarian Spatha

episodes.synopsis: Loyalties are tested as two families go head-to-head in forging a canister Damascus blade and a rapier inspired by the movie "The Princess Bride."
episodes.title: Family Edition

episodes.synopsis: Four smiths must forge camp knives out of steel from a barbecue. Then, two return to their home forges to recreate a pair of Frankish throwing axes.
episodes.title: Frankish Throwing Axes

episodes.synopsis: In a holiday episode, the smiths use the san mai technique in the first competition. Then, two smiths recreate the 1796 English light cavalry sword.
episodes.title: A Very Forged Christmas

episodes.synopsis: Four smiths must free their tools from a steel grate – then forge a knife from it. Two remain to head home and recreate a Chinese war sword.
episodes.title: The Chinese War Sword

episodes.synopsis: After four smiths forge signature blades from various Damascus patterns, two return to their home forges to create their versions of the mythical Sword in the Stone.
episodes.title: The Sword in the Stone

episodes.synopsis: Four smiths open crucibles to reveal surprise metals they'll use to forge blades; two move on to recreate Joyeuse, the legendary sword of Charlemagne.
episodes.title: Charlemagne's Sword

episodes.synopsis: Smiths are faced with two challenging recreations: the WWII Special Forces smatchet knife and the infamous sword wielded by Spanish conquistadors.
episodes.title: The Spanish Conquistador Sword

episodes.synopsis: A ship's wheel provides material for four smiths to fashion hada blades. In the final challenge, two recreate the deadly Filipino sword, the pira.
episodes.title: The Pira

episodes.synopsis: Smiths forge chef knives from old farm equipment in the first challenge; in the second, they recreate the iconic Rooster Head French pioneer sword.
episodes.title: French Pioneer Sword

episodes.synopsis: A Damascus blade challenge is followed by a home-forge recreation of a Darb Sri Gun Chai, the fearsome, double-handed Thai battle sword.
episodes.title: Darb Sri Gun Chai Battle Sword

episodes.synopsis: Two intense rounds of forging Japanese Natas using traditional techniques are followed by a home challenge: a recreation of the Zulu war axe.
episodes.title: Zulu War Axe

episodes.synopsis: The bladesmiths deal with shifting parameters for signature blades of 1095 steel, before advancing to a recreation of the long Chinese zhanmadao.
episodes.title: The Chinese Zhanmadao

episodes.synopsis: After advancing through a round of making canister Damascus blades from threaded bolts, two smiths go home to recreate deadly German dussage swords.
episodes.title: The German Dussage

episodes.synopsis: First responder bladesmiths forge tactical knives out of rescue tools, then two return home to recreate the firefighter's trusted Halligan bar.
episodes.title: First Responders Edition

episodes.synopsis: In a throwback to the Iron Age, smiths forge daggers using 7th-century B.C. methods. Then, two smiths recreate a popular "Game of Thrones" sword.
episodes.title: Game of Forge

episodes.synopsis: The smiths select a forging technique based on difficulty before learning what blade they're making. Then, two recreate prestigious ikakalaka swords.
episodes.title: The Ikakalaka

episodes.synopsis: In a samurai-themed competition, smiths must forge a Japanese tanto dagger, then two return home to reproduce a deadly pole weapon, the sodegarami.
episodes.title: Samurai Showdown

episodes.synopsis: Baby Boomers and Gen Z-ers face off in an "old vs. new" competition, before two smiths recreate China's Sword of Goujian at their home forges.
episodes.title: Baby Boomer vs Gen Z

episodes.synopsis: Scrap metal shavings become signature blades in the hands of the smiths, two of whom then recreate the nimcha, a sword made of recycled blades.
episodes.title: The Nimcha

episodes.synopsis: Four smiths forge handles with a metal never before used in the show: titanium. Two competitors move on to make a horseman's tabar and hidden dagger.
episodes.title: Titanium Smackdown

episodes.synopsis: The smiths must unlock boxes of steel to retrieve knife materials; two to home to fashion replicas of American classics: the tomahawk and bowie knife.
episodes.title: Tomahawk and Bowie

episodes.synopsis: An unusual assignment finds the smiths forging a puzzle-piece blade that must fit perfectly. Two then recreate the ancient samurai poleaxe, the ono.
episodes.title: Japanese Ono

episodes.synopsis: Former champions return to the forge to engage in rounds of competition that end with one going head-to-head with a judge to create a Cossack shashka.
episodes.title: Super Champion Edition

episodes.synopsis: The smiths must pay to play in a competition that's a budget buster. Then, two remain to recreate the most expensive sword ever: the Boateng Saber.
episodes.title: The Boateng Saber

episodes.synopsis: In the first of a two-part special, smiths face tests of their abilities, advancing to a round where they must make a set of Damascus throwing knives.
episodes.title: Summer Forging Games Part 1

episodes.synopsis: In the second half of a two-part special, three smiths are eager to win Damascus metal and $15,000 by forging a Greek Xiphos sword in one round.
episodes.title: Summer Forging Games Part 2
